items.q: Which continent is the largest by landmass?
items.explanation: Asia covers about 30% of Earth's total land area and is home to most of the world's population.

items.q: The Atlantic Ocean is the largest ocean on Earth.
items.explanation: The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest ocean on Earth.

items.q: Mount Everest is the highest mountain above sea level.
items.explanation: Located in the Himalayas on the border of Nepal and China, its peak is 8,848 meters (29,029 ft) above sea level.

items.q: What is the capital city of France?
items.explanation: Paris is a major European city and a global center for art, fashion, gastronomy, and culture.

items.q: Which country is both an island and a continent?
items.explanation: It is the world's smallest continent and largest island.

items.q: Name the longest river in the world.
items.explanation: Located in northeast Africa, the Nile is historically considered the longest river in the world.

items.a: A desert is a very dry region of land that receives extremely low amounts of precipitation per year.
items.explanation: The Sahara is the largest hot desert, while Antarctica is the largest cold desert.

items.q: Which imaginary line divides the Earth into the Northern and Southern Hemispheres?
What do we call a piece of land surrounded by water on all sides?
items.explanation: Examples include Hawaii, Madagascar, and Great Britain.

items.q: Which country has the largest population in the world?
items.explanation: Both nations have populations exceeding 1.4 billion people.
